items.q: In the 18-century London, mustard husks and pea flour were added to ____. a. salt b. pepper c. cheese d. milk
When black tea became popular, it was contaminated with a gum solution and tinted with lead. Another word for contaminated is ____. a. posed b. metabolized c. adulterated d. faked
In ____, England enacted the first British Food and Drug Act, which ended the practice of adding dangerous chemicals to food. a. 2004 b. 1776 c. 1860 d. 1900
The average American ingests about ____ pounds of food additives per year. a. 10 b. 5 c. 20 d. 50

Which is not a possible effect of the artificial sweetener aspartame? a. It can cause mental retardation in children. b. It can cause problems with brain function and behavior. c. It can cause chronic viruses. d. It can cause brain tumors.

A problem with using sodium nitrite and sodium nitrate is ____. a. it causes meat to turn red b. people will stop eating bacon when they know it might be dangerous c. at high heats, it can cause stomach cancer d. it might cause muscle diseases
Today's breakfast cereals for kids are ____ many different coloring dyes. a. protected from b. loaded with c. tastier with d. bitter from
The amount of milk ____ for each cow varies day by day. a. yield b. incidence c. peak d. insert
When a lactating cow is injected with BST, it ____. a. decreases its milk yield b. immediately gets an infection c. increases its milk yield d. produces sour milk
Currently, the use of BST in cows has become a ____ topic with dairy producers. a. injecting b. humorous c. controversial d. positive

Which issue is not an area of concern about the use of BST? a. Hormones ingested by the cows could also be ingested by humans in milk products b. Cattle ingested with BST frequently develop mastitis. c. It may increase the development of antibiotic resistant strains of bacteria. d. Human levels of BST in saliva are higher than in milk.

Which sentence does not indicate a cause? a. The river overflowed and flooded the town. b. When she walked into the room; she looked upset. c. There was no warning before the tsunami so many people drowned. d. Anna had a car accident and sprained her back.
The most frequent use of a causal chain essay in school is usually in ____. a. English classes b. the sciences c. math d. foreign languages
The scientists in Europe are still assessing the data about BST use in cows. Another word for assessing is ____. a. evaluating b. injecting c. digesting d. treating
The U.S. and Japan previously had a high incidence of stomach cancer. The word incidence means ____. a. frequency b. power c. assessment d. yield
If something is fake, it _____. a. is dangerous b. isn’t real c. is controversial d. causes illness
If you ingest something, you _____ it. a. dislike b. investigate c. avoid d. eat
Peak production means _____. a. annual production b. a growing level of production c. milk production d. the highest level of production
Food is digested in a cow’s _____. a. hormones b. gut c. blood d. gland
If you have concerns about a situation, you are _____ about it. a. confident b. enthusiastic c. worried d. knowledgeable
Cows normally produce milk for _____ after calving. a. about 50 weeks b. about 150 weeks c. about 300 days d. about 500 days
BST was approved in the U.S. in _____. a. the 1930s b. the 1950s c. the 1970s d. the 1990s
Which of the following do cows taking BST not usually eat? a. grass b. hay c. corn d. wheat
Food additives make food more flavorful and easy to prepare.
Food additives are a fairly new invention.
Some food additives act as beneficial preservatives, like salt.
Currently all milk from BST treated cows is labeled.
Artificial colorings and flavors are frequently added to foods because they are much cheaper to use than natural ingredients.
BST causes the liver to secrete the insulin-like substance IGF.
In a causal chain essay, the thesis statement should state the three or four steps in the chain.
The negative effects of BST released in a Canadian report runs counter to the information released in the U.S.. The phrase runs counter to means the opposite position .
Many common foods contain residues of additives. The word residues means something added.
Specific chemical additives have been linked to cancer. The words linked to mean associated with.
Mold helps make peanut butter smooth.
Differences of opinion are the cause of controversy .
A conglomeration is a mixture of different elements.
If a substance is metabolized , it is declared banned.
Posing a problem is the same as solving a problem.
A veterinarian is an animal doctor.
A herd is a group of animals.
When something is inserted, it is placed inside something else.
BST stands for Bovine System Technology.
Cows making milk consume up to 20% more food than other cows.
Large amounts of hormones are released into the bloodstream.
The people in 18th century London were poisoned by fake tea.
The British government does not allow the use of BST in cows.
The use of phenylalanine can cause mental retardation in babies.
Red tomatoes are plump and have perfect skin, but they don't have much flavor.
The rates of stomach cancer have decreased in the United States.
Write a causal essay analysis on the reasons college students have stress.
